snippet: Led by Simon Rattle, the orchestra will give two opening-night performances in the city next year, at Carnegie Hall and the White Light Festival.
abstract: Berlin Philharmonic, led by chief conductor Simon Rattle, will give two major opening night concerts in New York in fall season; first performance will open Carnegie Hall's 2014-2015 season at gala featuring violinist Ann-Sophie Mutter, followed by performances to open Lincoln Center's White Light Festival at Park Avenue Armory.
lead_paragraph: Led by Simon Rattle, the orchestra will give two opening-night performances in the city next year, at Carnegie Hall and the White Light Festival.

headline.main: Berlin Philharmonic Plans Major Concerts in New York
headline.print_headline: Berlin Philharmonic Plans Major Concerts in New York
